medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 5.5 months of age, 2 days prior to admission; the patient experienced cough, somnolence, fever (temperature rose to 38.6Â°C), labored breathing, decreased oral intake, and nonbloody diarrhea. Respiratory rate ranged from 30 to 50 breaths per minute, with oxygen saturation between 85% and 87%. Symptoms progressed with more pronounced chest retractions and hypoxemia, leading to hospitalization.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born after a full-term gestation via scheduled repeat cesarean section and had one febrile episode at 89 days of age. He received all routine childhood immunizations through 4 months of age, had no known allergies, or current medications.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes asthma in the father, maternal grandmother, paternal grandfather, and sibling. The mother smoked cigarettes outside the home.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives with his mother, one sibling, and maternal relatives. He attends daycare and there are no pets in the house.
